A

ADO - Class in algorithms
The ADO (adjacency degree ordering) algorithm works like the Welsh-Powell algorithm, but instead of ordering the vertices ones after degree, they will be ordered at every round after their adjacency degree.
ADO(Graph, int) - Constructor for class algorithms.ADO
 
Algorithm - Class in algorithms
This class provides the abstraction of an algorithm that can color a graph sequentially.
Algorithm(Graph, int) - Constructor for class algorithms.Algorithm
Constructor, an algorithm needs a graph and the number of colors he can use.

MinimaxAI - Class in <Unnamed>
This class implements a computer player that plays board games by using the minimax algorithm to 'minimize the maximum possible loss' of the player.
MinimaxAI(String) - Constructor for class MinimaxAI
Create a player with the given nickname.
MinimaxAI.Node - Class in <Unnamed>
 
MinimaxAI.Node(GameModel) - Constructor for class MinimaxAI.Node
Create the root node.
MinimaxAI.Node(GameModel, Move) - Constructor for class MinimaxAI.Node
Create a node that branches from the given board by applying the given move to a copy of the board.
move - Variable in class MinimaxAI.Node

S

SDO - Class in algorithms
The SDO (saturation degree ordering) algorithm works like the Welsh-Powell algorithm, but instead of ordering the vertices ones after degree, they will be ordered at every round after their saturation degree.
SDO(Graph, int) - Constructor for class algorithms.SDO
